intro: Erigeron sylvaticus, commonly known as woodland fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has hairy stems and leaves. Its flowers are blue to purple in color and bloom in late summer to early fall. It is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
